title: Where should you invest for the best returns: Isa, pension or property? Use our calculator to find out
text:
What's the best way to grow your money? This simple question is the cornerstone of financial planning – whether the goal is having enough cash to retire on, or to pass something on to the next generation.

The answer constantly changes. Governments of all stripes have tinkered with the regimes governing pensions, Isas and buy-to-let investing over the years. You can now save £20,000 a year into an Isa, while pensions are capped at £40,000, down from £255,000 in 2010.

Buy-to-let was once the golden goose of the middle classes, but has become progressively less lucrative. So what's the best home for £10,000, £50,000 or £1m today? Our calculator (below) shows just how much your investment could grow...
description: Whether you're investing £100k or £10k, our calculator will show you the best way to make the most money.
